jobDescription: Purpose of JobPerforms work assignments and problem resolution in support of Treasury Operations through one or more of the following activities: enterprise treasury process improvement efforts, operational trend analysis, system troubleshooting and support, and operational cost analysis/benchmarking. Provides program/project support to Agile Product Owners and program/project leads. May lead moderate to complex Money Movement programs.  We are currently seeking a Treasury Operations Analyst I for our San Antonio, TX location.  Job Requirements Performs moderately complex system troubleshooting work.Resolves issues and navigates obstacles to deliver work product.Performs moderately complex reconciliations and exceptions research to include create, review and update Knowledge Deliver procedures.Facilitates moderately complex process improvement initiatives with cross functional teams using intermediate knowledge of the business, its products and processes.Collaborates with IT to implement system upgrades.Develops test cases and facilitates moderately complex system testing and implementations.Performs research to resolve moderately complex accounting problems and responds to audit research requests and issues. Minimum Experience Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, IT, or a related field required; 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree.4 or more years of related experience and accountability for complex tasks and/or projects required.Proficient knowledge of the function/discipline and demonstrated application of knowledge, skills and abilities towards work products required.Proficient level of business acumen in the areas of the business operations, industry practices and emerging trends required.Qualifications may warrant placement in a different job level* When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. This will take approximately 5 minutes. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not able to change your responses.  Preferred Functional expert with the Concur Travel&Expense; system and Administrator functions; responsible for Concur Expense system daily processing, auditing and issue resolutionSupport the administration and training of employees on Concur Expense platform and enforcement of the USAA Corporate Credit Card GuidelinesAccounts Payable experience to include solid understanding of the IRS 1099 Reporting for Vendors; oversight of the vendor maintenance records in PeopleSoft for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with IRS regulations; assist with vendor 1099 mailing and reporting; submit 1099 tax forms to the IRS by coordinating efforts with IT and Tax areas to ensure smooth and timely completion of 1099 data being reported. The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.  At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits package in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals.  USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers.  Relocation assistance is not available for this position. For Internal Candidates: Must complete 12 months in current position (from date of hire or date of placement), or must have manager's approval prior to posting.  Last day for internal candidates to apply to the opening is 6/28/18 by 11:59 pm CST time.
